title: "We're not going to Old Trafford for a draw": Moreno says Klopp wants all three points against Man United
text:
Moreno says Klopp always sends his teams out to win (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Alberto Moreno insists Liverpool are not going to Old Trafford for a draw and will be "going out to win the game". 
Jurgen Klopp 's side are second in the Premier League, four places and five points clear of Manchester United . 
Defeat to Jose Mourinho's in-form side in this weekend's crucial game would mean the gap between the two arch rivals is cut to just points. 
However, Moreno insists the Liverpool boss is sending his side out for all three points when they meet on Sunday. 
The Spanish defender told Liverpool's website : "Wherever we go, we go out to win the game, whether it’s at Anfield or wherever, we want to get the three points... Read More Klopp wants all three points at Old Trafford on Sunday (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) The Spanish defender's appearances have been limited largely to cup games this season (Photo: Andrew Powell) 
“In my time at the club I’ve never won a league game against Manchester United so I’m anxious for that to come about. So why not this weekend?” 
Moreno, who arrived at Anfield from Sevilla in 2014, has only made two Premier League starts this season, largely because of James Milner's form at left back. 
But the 24-year-old is desperate to show boss Klopp he has a future at the club and has been impressing in training. Read More Jurgen Klopp backs Liverpool to respond to Southampton defeat with "brave" display against Manchester United 
Moreno went on: "I’m still the same player that I’ve always been. So that means I work, both on the field and in training, in the same way... 
"I’m always at 100%, really giving it everything I’ve got in every training session, always working to the limit and the maximum all the time. James Milner's form for Liverpool has kept Moreno out of the team (Photo: Andrew Powell) But the ex-Sevilla player continues to work hard in training and is being patient (Photo: Liverpool FC/Getty Images) 
"What you need to do then is try to show the manager that you’re ready, I want to demonstrate that I’m ready for whenever he calls on me, but I respect that it’s his decision who plays. 
"It’s true that I’ve not had as many opportunities this season, but I’m still the same player and still working hard and that’s what it’s all about - keep positive so that when you are called upon, you’re ready." poll loading Who are you backing for Sunday's game at Old Trafford? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
